com.baypackets.ase.sbb
Interface MediaServer

public interface MediaServer

The MediaServer interface provides the details of a Media Server including its ID, Name, Status, Host, Port and capabilities. The application writer may provide media server capabilities in addition to those defined by this interface's public static constants.

Note: The application writer should take care to use bit set values that do not overlap the ones defined in this interface.

Field Summary
static int CAPABILITY_AUDIO_CONFERENCING
          Media Server's capability to do audio conferencing.
static int CAPABILITY_AUDIO_RECORDING
          Media Server's capability to record audio messages.
static int CAPABILITY_DIGIT_COLLECTION
          Media Server's capability to play and collect digits.
static int CAPABILITY_VAR_ANNOUNCEMENT
          Media Server's capability to play variable announcements.
static int CAPABILITY_VOICE_XML
          Media Server's capability to use Voice XML.

Method Detail

getCapabilities

public int getCapabilities()
Returns the capabilities of the Media Server.

Returns:
The capabilities of this Media Server.

getHost

public java.net.InetAddress getHost()
Returns the host of the Media Server.

Returns:
The host of the Media Server.

getId

public java.lang.String getId()
Returns the ID of the Media Server. This value is a unique identifier for each media server provisioned in the system.

Returns:
The ID of the Media Server.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the Media Server. More than one media server could have the same name. If the selectByName() method is called on the MediaServerSelector and if there are more than one ACTIVE media servers with the specified name, then the selector applies a load-balancing logic on them and returns one media server.

Returns:
The name of the Media Server.

getPort

public int getPort()
Returns the port of the Media Server.

Returns:
The port where the Media Server is listening.

isActive

public boolean isActive()
Returns whether the Media Server is ACTIVE or not.

Returns:
true if the Media Server is ACTIVE else false.

isCapable

public boolean isCapable(int capabilities)
Returns the status of whether or not the Media Server has all the specified capabilities.

Parameters:
capabilities - - the integer value acquired by performing a logical OR of all the capabilities required.
Returns:
true if the Media Server has all the specified capabilities.

getAnnouncementBaseURI

public java.net.URI getAnnouncementBaseURI()
Returns the URI of the root directory where all announcement files are stored.

Returns:
The URI of the announcement file root directory or NULL if none was defined in this media server's configuration.

getAdaptorClassName

public java.lang.String getAdaptorClassName()
Returns the fully qualified name of the MsAdaptor class used to communicate with this media server.

getRecordingBaseURI

public java.net.URI getRecordingBaseURI()
Returns the URI of the root directory where all recording files are placed after a PLAY/RECORD operation is performed by this media server.

Returns:
The URI of the root directory where all recording files are copied to or NULL if no root directory was provisioned with this media server.

getSupportedAttributes

public java.util.Iterator getSupportedAttributes()
Returns the list of attribute names supported by this media server.

Returns:
The list of supported attributes or an empty Iterator if none are supported.

getAttributeNames

public java.util.Iterator getAttributeNames()
Returns the names of those attributes whose values are set.

Returns:
The list of set attributes or an empty Iterator if none are currently set.

getAttribute

public java.lang.Object getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
Returns the value of the specified attribute or NULL if the attribute is not currently set.

Parameters:
name - - The name of the attribute to return.

setAttribute

public void setAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.Object value)
Sets the specified attribute.

Parameters:
name - - The name of the attribute to set.
value - - The value to set on the attribute.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no such attribute is supported by the media server or if the specified value is invalid.
